name: Framebuffer.bash
tagline: framebuffer in bash to draw ascii pixels, borders, animate e.g. (bash ui bootstrap)
body:
### Why

Fullfledged html/css/javascript applications are nice, but sometimes a simple email with asciitext does the job.
This is for minimalists and productivity fanatics.

### Barchart plugin

will produce something like this:

     apple   : ——▄▄▀▀——▀▀▄▄——▄▄▀▀▄▄———

     pear    : __▄▄██__██▄▄__▄▄██▄▄___

     banana  : ▀▀▄▄▀▀▄▄▀▀▀▀———————————

     plum    : ██████
     orange  : ████
     apple   : ██
     foo     : ██████████

code examples:

    put 2 3  "stock   :"; echo "0,1,2,0,2,1,0,1,2,1" | barchart 10 2 20 
    put 2 7  "banana  :"; redis-cli --csv LRANGE foo 0 -1 | sed 's/[^0-9,\\-]*//g' | vbarchart 10 6 20

### Histogram plugin

turns logs into:

    UFW        1600 █████████████████████████ 
    cfg80211:    11 █████████████ 
    wlan0:        9 █████ 
    ath:          8 █ 

code examples:

    dmesg | histogram 2 25 25
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
